H0.text: 0°C is the temperature at which water begins to boil.

H1.text: 32°C is the temperature at which water begins to boil.

H2.text: 100°C is the temperature at which water begins to boil.

H3.text: 212°C is the temperature at which water begins to boil.

A4.text: water boils at 100°C (or with scientific precision: 99.97 °C (211.95 °F)) under standard pressure at sea level

A5.text: The normal boiling point is commonly given as 100 °C (212 °F) at a pressure of 1 atm
